detectedIssueDefinition.text: There are reports of enhanced as well as diminished effects of anticoagulants when given concurrently with corticosteroids (prednisone). Therefore, coagulation indices should be monitored to maintain the desired anticoagulant effect.

detectedIssueManagement.text: Will check INR values daily for remaining duration of Prednisone therapy

detectedIssueDefinition.text: Those who take acetaminophen along with the widely used blood-thinning drug warfarin may face the risk of serious internal bleeding. People on warfarin who take acetaminophen for at least seven days in a row should be closely watched for bleeding.

detectedIssueManagement.text: Patient has been instructed to discontinue Tylenol use.

detectedIssueDefinition.text: Warfarin appears to be especially hazardous after a transient ischaemic attack or minor stroke; in one trial, 14 months of warfarin therapy with a relatively high target INR of 3.0-4.5 increased major bleeding from 0.9% to 8.1%, intracranial bleeding from 0.5% to 4.1%, and fatal intracranial bleeding from 0.2% to 2.6% (relative to low dose aspirin therapy). Bleeding is most likely during the first three months of treatment, and often follows trauma or unmasks a previously unsuspected comorbidity.

detectedIssueManagement.text: Will check INR values daily for first 3 weeks and every 3 days for next 10 weeks
Informed patient of risks and warning signs for internal bleeding

reasonCode.originalText: Patient finds generics hard to swallow
